newsitem.title: USA: White House names new social secretary.
newsitem.headline: White House names new social secretary.

text.p: Ann Stock, the White House social secretary, will leave her post next month and be replaced by Capricia Marshall, a close aide to first lady Hillary Rodham Clinton, it was announced Friday.
Stock has served since 1993 as social secretary, overseeing all social functions at the White House. She had worked at the White House in the 1970s as an aide to Vice President Walter Mondale.
Marshall has been executive assistant to Mrs. Clinton.
